rows.label: qst710801_msg0001
rows.name:
He'll be loitering around somewhere.
No doubt about it...

rows.label: qst710801_msg0002
rows.name:
Ah, sorry.
Are you a customer?

rows.label: qst710801_msg0003
rows.name:
I'm afraid you'll have to wait
a bit for the shop to reopen.

rows.label: qst710801_msg0004
rows.name:
My husband's gone AWOL...
Well, he went out to get fish...

rows.label: qst710801_msg0005
rows.name:
Then the Grail attacked and all the
fish round here went belly up, you
remember?

rows.label: qst710801_msg0006
rows.name:
Well around that time, he said, "I'll
catch the fish myself!" and went
off by himself somewhere...

rows.label: qst710801_msg0007
rows.name: And he's not been back since.

rows.label: qst710801_msg0008
rows.name:
The fish are back at the aquaculture
shop now, so there's no reason not to
reopen the shop except...no husband.

rows.label: qst710801_msg0009
rows.name:
And there are lots of monsters outside...
So I can't exactly abandon the shop
and go wandering.

rows.label: qst710801_msg0010
rows.name:
I'm ashamed to burden a customer
with something like this, but...

rows.label: qst710801_msg0011
rows.name:
I need someone to find my husband,
and to tell him to get back here, to the
capital. Can you help me?

rows.label: qst710801_msg0012
rows.name:
My husband said that he wanted to go
up to Coolley Lake to land a big catch
someday, so you might start up there.

rows.label: qst710801_msg0013
rows.name: Hope you can find him for me. Thanks!
